 82    def __init__(  # noqa: PLR0913 - parameters mirror external API options
 83        self,
 84        user_agent: str,
 85        contact_email: str,
 86        openalex_base: str = "https://api.openalex.org",
 87        unpaywall_base: str = "https://api.unpaywall.org",
 88        pdf_host_base: str | None = None,
 89        out_dir: str = "/data/pdfs",
 90    ) -> None:
 91        """Return init.
 92
 93        Parameters
 94        ----------
 95        user_agent : str
 96            Description for ``user_agent``.
 97        contact_email : str
 98            Description for ``contact_email``.
 99        openalex_base : str, optional
100            Description for ``openalex_base``.
101        unpaywall_base : str, optional
102            Description for ``unpaywall_base``.
103        pdf_host_base : str | None, optional
104            Description for ``pdf_host_base``.
105        out_dir : str, optional
106            Description for ``out_dir``.
107
108        Examples
109        --------

111        >>> __init__(..., ..., ..., ..., ..., ...)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS

[docs]
121        self.ua = user_agent




[docs]
122        self.email = contact_email




[docs]
123        self.openalex = openalex_base.rstrip("/")




[docs]
124        self.unpaywall = unpaywall_base.rstrip("/")




[docs]
125        self.pdf_host = (pdf_host_base or "").rstrip("/")




[docs]
126        self.out_dir = out_dir


127        os.makedirs(self.out_dir, exist_ok=True)


[docs]
128        self.session = requests.Session()


129        self.session.headers.update({"User-Agent": f"{self.ua} ({self.email})"})

[docs]
131    def search(self, topic: str, years: str, max_works: int) -> list[dict[str, Any]]:
132        """Return search.
133
134        Parameters
135        ----------
136        topic : str
137            Description for ``topic``.
138        years : str
139            Description for ``years``.
140        max_works : int
141            Description for ``max_works``.
142
143        Returns
144        -------
145        List[dict[str, Any]]
146            Description of return value.
147
148        Examples
149        --------
150        >>> from download.harvester import search
151        >>> result = search(..., ..., ...)
152        >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
153
154        See Also
155        --------
156        download.harvester
157
158        Notes
159        -----
160        Provide usage considerations, constraints, or complexity notes.
161        """
162        url = f"{self.openalex}/works"
163        params: dict[str, str | int] = {
164            "topic": topic,
165            "per_page": min(200, max_works),
166            "cursor": "*",
167        }
168        if years:
169            params["filter"] = years
170        response = self.session.get(url, params=params, timeout=30)
171        response.raise_for_status()
172        data = response.json()
173        return data.get("results", [])[:max_works]


174


[docs]
175    def resolve_pdf(self, work: dict[str, Any]) -> str | None:
176        """Return resolve pdf.
177
178        Parameters
179        ----------
180        work : Mapping[str, Any]
181            Description for ``work``.
182
183        Returns
184        -------
185        str | None
186            Description of return value.
187
188        Examples
189        --------
190        >>> from download.harvester import resolve_pdf
191        >>> result = resolve_pdf(...)
192        >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
193
194        See Also
195        --------
196        download.harvester
197
198        Notes
199        -----
200        Provide usage considerations, constraints, or complexity notes.
201        """
202        best = work.get("best_oa_location") or {}
203        if best and best.get("pdf_url"):
204            return best["pdf_url"]
205        for location in work.get("locations", []):
206            if location.get("pdf_url"):
207                return location["pdf_url"]
208        doi = work.get("doi")
209        if doi:
210            response = self.session.get(
211                f"{self.unpaywall}/v2/{doi}", params={"email": self.email}, timeout=15
212            )
213            if response.ok:
214                payload = response.json()
215                url = (payload.get("best_oa_location") or {}).get("url_for_pdf")
216                if url:
217                    return url
218        if self.pdf_host and doi:
219            return f"{self.pdf_host}/pdf/{doi.replace('/', '_')}.pdf"
220        return None


221


[docs]
222    def download_pdf(self, url: str, target_path: str) -> str:
223        """Return download pdf.
224
225        Parameters
226        ----------
227        url : str
228            Description for ``url``.
229        target_path : str
230            Description for ``target_path``.
231
232        Returns
233        -------
234        str
235            Description of return value.
236
237        Raises
238        ------
239        DownloadError
240            Raised when validation fails.
241        UnsupportedMIMEError
242            Raised when validation fails.
243
244        Examples
245        --------
246        >>> from download.harvester import download_pdf
247        >>> result = download_pdf(..., ...)
248        >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
249
250        See Also
251        --------
252        download.harvester
253
254        Notes
255        -----
256        Provide usage considerations, constraints, or complexity notes.
257        """
258        response = self.session.get(url, timeout=60)
259        if response.status_code != HTTP_OK:
260            message = f"Bad status {response.status_code} for {url}"
261            raise DownloadError(message)
262        content_type = response.headers.get("Content-Type", "application/pdf")
263        if not content_type.startswith("application/"):
264            message = f"Not a PDF-like content type: {content_type}"
265            raise UnsupportedMIMEError(message)
266        with open(target_path, "wb") as file_handle:
267            file_handle.write(response.content)
268        return target_path


269


[docs]
270    def run(self, topic: str, years: str, max_works: int) -> list[Doc]:
271        """Return run.
272
273        Parameters
274        ----------
275        topic : str
276            Description for ``topic``.
277        years : str
278            Description for ``years``.
279        max_works : int
280            Description for ``max_works``.
281
282        Returns
283        -------
284        List[Doc]
285            Description of return value.
286
287        Examples
288        --------
289        >>> from download.harvester import run
290        >>> result = run(..., ..., ...)
291        >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
292
293        See Also
294        --------
295        download.harvester
296
297        Notes
298        -----
299        Provide usage considerations, constraints, or complexity notes.
300        """
301        docs: list[Doc] = []
302        works = self.search(topic, years, max_works)
303        for work in works:
304            pdf_url = self.resolve_pdf(work)
305            if not pdf_url:
306                continue
307            filename = (work.get("doi") or work.get("id") or str(int(time.time() * 1000))).replace(
308                "/", "_"
309            ) + ".pdf"
310            destination = os.path.join(self.out_dir, filename)
311            self.download_pdf(pdf_url, destination)
312            doc = Doc(
313                id=f"urn:doc:source:openalex:{work.get('id', 'unknown')}",
314                openalex_id=work.get("id"),
315                doi=work.get("doi"),
316                title=work.get("title", ""),
317                authors=[],
318                pub_date=None,
319                license=None,
320                language="en",
321                pdf_uri=destination,
322                source="openalex",
323                content_hash=None,
324            )
325            docs.append(doc)
326        return docs
